Nodejdbc » Index » CallableStatement

Class: CallableStatement

Defined in: src/callablestatement.coffee
Inherits: PreparedStatement

Overview

Connection object to a datasource. @see {NodeJDBC#config} Queries and methods are executed using a connection object.

Instance Method Summary

  • # (void) registerOutParameter(index, type) Registers the OUT parameter in ordinal position parameterIndex to the JDBC type sqlType.
  • # (string) getString(index) @sync

    Retrieves the value of the designated JDBC CHAR, VARCHAR, or LONGVARCHAR parameter as a string

    @param index parameter position.
  • # (int) getInt(index) @sync

    Retrieves the value of the designated JDBC CHAR, VARCHAR, or LONGVARCHAR parameter as an integer

    @param index parameter position.
  • # (int) getType(type) returns int representation of the type

Instance Method Details

# (void) registerOutParameter(index, type)

Registers the OUT parameter in ordinal position parameterIndex to the JDBC type sqlType.

Parameters:

  • index ( int ) — parameter position. first parameter is 1, second 2 ...
  • sql ( String ) — type identifier @see java.sql.Types @example for java.sql.Types.INTEGER just pass 'INTEGER' @example for java.sql.Types.CHAR just pass 'CHAR' The above examples apply to all types in java.sql.Type. In short ; just pass the string representation of the type name

@sync

@param index parameter position. first parameter is 1, second 2 ...

  • ( string ) — get parameter value as string

# (int) getType(type)

returns int representation of the type

Returns:

  • ( int ) — integer representation of the java.sql.Types.{TYPE} constant
